name: Banana Layer Cake with Caramel Frosting
description: Banana Layer Cake with Caramel Frosting is easy to make, fluffy, soft and delicious! Three layers of moist banana cake sandwiched together with luscious caramel mascarpone frosting.

recipe_ingredient.note: 350 g (2 ¾ cups) flour plain/ all purpose flour
recipe_ingredient.display: 350 g (2 ¾ cups) flour plain/ all purpose flour

recipe_ingredient.note: 200 g (7/8 cup) unsalted butter or margarine softened
recipe_ingredient.display: 200 g (7/8 cup) unsalted butter or margarine softened

recipe_ingredient.note: 2 ripe bananas mashed well or liquidised
recipe_ingredient.display: 2 ripe bananas mashed well or liquidised

recipe_ingredient.note: 200 g (1 cup) oz icing sugar ( (powdered sugar)
recipe_ingredient.display: 200 g (1 cup) oz icing sugar ( (powdered sugar)

recipe_ingredient.note: 450 g (1 pound) full fat mascarpone cheese
recipe_ingredient.display: 450 g (1 pound) full fat mascarpone cheese

recipe_ingredient.note: 120 ml (½ cup) COLD double cream (heavy cream) (more if needed)
recipe_ingredient.display: 120 ml (½ cup) COLD double cream (heavy cream) (more if needed)

recipe_ingredient.note: 3-4 tbsp caramel sauce (plus extra to drizzle)
recipe_ingredient.display: 3-4 tbsp caramel sauce (plus extra to drizzle)

recipe_ingredient.note: ½ tbsp vanilla paste or extract
recipe_ingredient.display: ½ tbsp vanilla paste or extract

recipe_instructions.title: MAKE THE CAKE
recipe_instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180C (350F). Mist three 20cm (8 in) cake tins with cake release or grease with softened butter and dust with flour shaking out any excess. Line the bottom of the tins with baking paper.

Put the flour and sugar in a large bowl. Add the baking powder, bicarbonate of soda and salt and mix together using a balloon whisk. Add the softened butter, eggs, milk, mashed bananas and vanilla extract.

Beat on the lowest speed setting until the ingredients start to combine then increase the speed until you have a smooth batter. Use a spatula to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl to make sure everything is evenly mixed.

Divide the batter between the prepared cake tins and level. Bake for 25-28 minutes, or until the cake is well risen, springy to the tough and a skewer inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool the cake in the tins for 5-10 minutes then carefully turn out onto a cooling rack.

recipe_instructions.title: CARAMEL FROSTING
recipe_instructions.text: Put all the frosting ingredients apart from the caramel in a mixing bowl (or the bowl of your stand mixer). Start beating together on a low speed setting then increase to medium, gradually adding the caramel. Continue to beat until the frosting holds peaks, adding more cream gradually if the frosting is dense. Don’t overmix.

recipe_instructions.title: ASSEMBLE AND FROST THE CAKE
recipe_instructions.text: Pipe or spread frosting on the cake layers and sandwich together. Cover the cake with a thin layer of frosting and smooth.

Drizzle caramel around the edge of the cake letting it drip down the sides. Pipe or spread any remaining frosting on top of the cake and drizzle with more caramel. Decorate with caramel fudge pieces or banana chips.
